Title: In Russia, over two years, more than 2,200 women became victims o...
Description: In Russia, over two years, more than 2,200 women became victims of domestic violence. The influence of war veterans in Ukraine turned out to be -few-By data of the -Algorithm of Light- project, in 2022‚Äì2023 in the country 2,284 women became victims of domestic violence, of which 2,123 of them were killed by their partners, the rest by relatives. In total, 3,436 women were killed over two years. At the same time, according to the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the Russian Federation, which is cited by the -Algorithm of Light-, in 2023, compared to 2022, 2% fewer murders were registered (Article 105 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation), 6% fewer rapes (Article 131 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation), 4% fewer cases of causing serious harm to health (Article 111 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation). During January-July 2024, the Ministry of Internal Affairs registered 15,600 violent crimes, which is 6% less than the same period last year. According to the state statistics portal, in 2023 the number of deaths from violent crimes decreased from 9,366 people in 2022 to 8,792 in 2023.In 65 criminal cases checked by the Light Algorithm, war participants appeared in Ukraine. In 11 of these convictions the victim was a woman, only 8 of these involved domestic violence - 7 by a partner and 1 by a relative. It is impossible to draw conclusions about how often women died at the hands of SVO participants in 2022-2023; their number turned out to be small for analysis, notes Algorithm of Light.However, it is believed that the courts may not provide information about the previous criminal record of ex-prisoners or their participation in the -SVO-. In the recent research journalists found cases where, after the publication of sentences for participants in the war in Ukraine, materials the courts edited them, removing data on state awards or completely erasing the published text of the verdict.

Title: üñº The State Duma introduced criminal liability for theft and dat...
Description: The State Duma introduced criminal liability for theft and leaks of data of Russians. The first amendment concerned the bot for -breaking through-, which is used by security forcesToday, the State Duma unanimously adopted in the 2nd and 3rd final readings a package of bills that tightens administrative liability and introduces criminal liability for the leakage of personal data . -The punishment will directly depend on the volume of the leak: for legal entities it will range from 5 to 15 million rubles. In the event of a repeated leak, the company will have to pay a turnover fine: from 1 to 3% of its last year‚Äôs turnover. The toughest sanctions are provided for leaks of biometric personal data. In case of repeated violation, the fine will be up to 25 million to 0.5 billion rubles,- Deputy Khinshtein explained the procedure for fines. The law also introduces a prison sentence for the illegal use, collection, storage or transfer of personal data obtained illegally. Up to 4 years without aggravating circumstances and up to 10 years if the crime was committed by a group of people or resulted in grave consequences. Today, the administration of -Eyes of God-, the most popular bot for -breaking through- the personal data of Russians, responded to the amendments. According to the amendments, administering such a bot may be punishable by imprisonment. After the adoption of the law, the bot greatly reduced its functionality, ASTRA was convinced: from the -Eye of God- the output indicating the leaks used to break through, addresses, detailed search by full name without date of birth and many other functions disappeared.-With Today, the information in my systems is significantly limited.-‚Äî confirmed to the publication MSK1.ru creator of -Eyes of God- Evgeny Antipov. -Eye of God- -considered one of the most complete and loyal to the authorities: security forces do not hide the fact that they use it in operational work-, - wrote investigative journalist Andrey Zakharov. He added that the law adopted today by the State Duma is called by independent media the -law against investigative journalists-, since for many years they have been using data leaks and bots like the -Eyes of God- to investigate corruption and the activities of the Russian special services.
